entry.title: Josef Hoop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that under the premiership of Josef Hoop (pictured), the Progressive Citizens' Party was the first party to hold an absolute majority in the Landtag of Liechtenstein?

entry.title: S1/S2 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the S1/S2 rolling stock of the Amsterdam Metro was also a tram?

entry.title: Iman Mahdavi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when refugee Iman Mahdavi boarded a plane in Turkey, he did not know its destination?

entry.title: Chand Sifarish (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an AI-generated cover of Shaan and Kailash Kher's "Chand Sifarish" received nearly five million views on Instagram in two days?

entry.title: We did it, Joe! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Keke Palmer did an impression of "We did it, Joe!" onstage with Kamala Harris?

entry.title: Nam Su-hyeon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Nam Su-hyeon, Jeon Hun-young, and Lim Si-hyeon's gold medal in the women's team archery event at the 2024 Olympics marked South Korea's tenth victory in a row?

entry.title: siege of Perth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a warrant was issued to pay a force to relieve the siege of Perth in October 1339, after the garrison had already surrendered?

entry.title: Robert Aiello (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Robert Aiello's first novel was published after literary agents turned it down roughly 60 times?

entry.title: Schlag den Henssler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a clip of a soft pretzel being cut perfectly in half made the short-lived German game show Schlag den Henssler briefly popular to an international audience?
